nodes.bodyText: In the UI it looked like Gender was a checkbox. Should it be a radio button if they're mutually exclusive?

nodes.bodyText: Please don't return a null list if you can avoid it. Can you use Collections.emptyList()?
Maybe getGenderEnumList() would be clearer.
Should we be using List, or would Set be better? I.e. does order matter? I don't think we want duplicate entries.
Should we burn the old 1 & 2 values and make new ones for MAN and WOMAN? Or are they really exact replacements?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -54,8 +54,8 @@
 
   private static final BiMap<Gender, Short> CLIENT_TO_STORAGE_GENDER =
       ImmutableBiMap.<Gender, Short>builder()
-          .put(Gender.MALE, (short) 1)
-          .put(Gender.FEMALE, (short) 2)
+          .put(Gender.MAN, (short) 1)

nodes.bodyText: Its the exact replacement, i can still have this as MALE AND FEMALE and have ui label MAN and WOMAN , but since we are going to reintroduce the table itself i thought its best that our enum matches the label

nodes.bodyText: If we receive PREFER_NO_ANSWER, should we disallow any other choices in the list?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -77,7 +77,7 @@ definitions:
 
   Gender:
     type: string
-    enum: &Gender [MALE, FEMALE, NON_BINARY, TRANSGENDER, INTERSEX, NONE, PREFER_NO_ANSWER]
+    enum: &Gender [MAN, WOMAN, NON_BINARY, TRANSGENDER, INTERSEX, NONE, PREFER_NO_ANSWER]

nodes.bodyText: I agree prefer not to answer and Non of these describe me should have additional checks,  not just for GENDER but also for other field like SEX AT BIRTH, we do not have that logic as of now (even on UI) we might introduce that later

nodes.bodyText: I wouldn't name this option NONE, because when I read it I assumed it meant "I have no gender (agender)". Which isn't 100% the same as this statement I don't think.
nit: this value should be moved to a higher level since it can be used for non-gender-related things. Also I'd use UPPER_SNAKE_CASE.
This confused me because gender is singular: I'd probably name this selfReportedGenders or something. Here and in other code.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3750,6 +3750,10 @@ definitions:
         type: boolean
       lgbtqIdentity:
         type: string
+      gender:

nodes.bodyText:
I think we should consider making it a bad request if NONE or PREFER_NO_ANSWER aren't by themselves. The UI should probably enforce that as well.
We should definitely allow combining the others though.
Since that logic is not just limited to gender we can have another PR/story to take care of it.
Yeah, I think only some of these are checkboxes (combinable) and some (at least "none of these..." should be by themselves.
nit: can this be a set instead of a list?
Good point will change this to set
However this will . be consistent with other elements will it be ok if i can have another PR to have it for all the elements (race ,sexAtbirth)?
